“The most powerful men at Penn State failed to take any steps for 14 years to protect the children who Sandusky victimized," the damning report revealed.
NEW YORK NIGHTMARE Woman visiting city raped in her hotel room
A tourist was raped in her Bronx hotel room by a tattooed man she had talked to on the subway, police said Thursday.
Mitt made 'calculated move' to get booed at NAACP: Dem
House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., does not think the boos Mitt Romney heard during his speech at the NAACP on Wednesday were altogether unwelcome.
At least six dead, 12 missing in catastrophic avalanche in Alps
Dozens of gendarmes were furiously searching through the snow for survivors of a doomed expedition that included 28 climbers from Britain, Denmark, France, Germany, Serbia, Spain and Switzerland, officials said.
Manhattan rents: Highest rise in FIVE years
Hoping Manhattan rents have gotten so incredibly high that the bubble’s about to burst? Fuhgeddaboudit! The median rental price for a Manhattan apartment surged to $3,125, according to a new report.

Jay-Z added two more shows to the slate of concerts christening the Barclays Center.
Due to incredible demand for presale tickets for his initial three concerts, Hova will also perform shows on Oct. 3 and Oct. 4.
Man's corpse kept in woman's home for months - so she could watch NASCAR with him
A woman said she kept the dead body of her companion in a chair in their southern Michigan house for months because she didn’t want to be alone.
Chilling text sent from missing woman's phone: 'The girl with this phone is dead'
Police suspect a 26-year-old Queens woman who has disappeared may have joined a cult — but her family adamantly believes she has been harmed.
Can't catch a cab in the outer boroughs? It's because they're working in Jersey
Yellow cab drivers make hundreds of thousands of pickups and dropoffs in the Garden State each year — even though their services are needed in the five boroughs.
No Jersey Shore- or other Viacom stuff- for 20 million DirecTV clients
More than 20 million DirecTV customers can no longer watch "The Daily Show," "SpongeBob SquarePants" or even "Jersey Shore.
The future Katie feared for Suri: British boarding school preps kids for hard-core Scientology life
Katie Holmes' decision to file for divorce from Tom Cruise, reportedly over concerns about the role of Scientology in the life of daughter Suri, has turned attention to its schools.

Jeter: Not all fans are idiots
As the most high-profile player on the Yankees, Derek Jeter hears boos in opposing ballparks nearly every game. But when those rival fans bring his family into the picture, it can ruin what may have otherwise been good-natured fun.
Mets' Gee facing season-ending surgery to repair artery
Dillon Gee's season could be over. The Mets' right-hander will have surgery Friday in to repair a damaged artery in his pitching shoulder caused by a blood clot.
In Like Lin: Knicks' Woodson says Jeremy starts over Kidd
Knicks coach Mike Woodson confirmed on Wednesday that Jeremy Lin, who has just 25 career starts under his belt, will start ahead of Jason Kidd, the future Hall of Fame point guard.

Nabe rallies, judge rips suspects in shooting of Brooklyn toddler
The pair of punks accused in the shootout that injured a Brooklyn 3-year-old were ordered held on $1 million bail Wednesday amid continuing political uproar over street violence.
Pro-lesbian Super PAC formed to $$$
A new pro-lesbian Super PAC launched on Wednesday with plans to raise $1 million for political candidates around the country who support women’s reproductive rights and LGBT families, Politico reported.
What animal could do this? Tortured dog’s tongue yanked out
Texas cops are searching for a psycho who tortured and nearly killed a dog by yanking her tongue out — and taping her snout shut with electrical tape.
Guthrie no quick fix for 'Today'
Cold case murder-OWS DNA 'link' was a lab mess-up: Sources
A sloppy city worker may be responsible for a tantalizing DNA match that seemed to link the murder of Sarah Fox to an Occupy Wall Street protest, sources told the Daily News on Wednesday.
Rep. Jesse Jackson treated for ’mood disorder’
A statement from Congressman Jesse Jackson Jr.’s office says the Chicago Democrat is receiving “intensive medical treatment” for a “mood disorder.” The statement Wednesday gives no details about his location and comes a month after Jackson went on medical leave.
Urban Dictionary defines Sen. Harry Reid after sexual position
The Urban Dictionary, which compiles user-submitted slang expressions online, defines “Harry Reid” as: “A sexual position where you climb on top and then do absolutely nothing.”
Are women worse drivers...in Germany?
Are women worse drivers than men? It depends on who you ask. A few parking garages in China and the mayor of a small German town believe they are. They have created extra-wide parking spaces with an array of markings to indicate they are women-only.

The woman’s body was found outside Tuesday afternoon, near Interstate 4 in Polk City, Fla.

Boxer’s 109-room mansion was purchased by JP Morgan Chase at a foreclosure auction in March, but Holyfield is just now leaving the home.

The first photo to ever be uploaded to the Internet is, not surprisingly, pretty underwhelming. The image was uploaded by World Wide Web inventor Tim Berners-Lee in 1992.
